properties.product_description: Fresh produce, bread, eggs, dairy.
properties.vendor_description: Fresh Routes is a not-for-profit social enterprise that is focused on creating new, innovative ways of providing healthy and affordable food to as many Canadians as possible ? especially those who need it most.

properties.product_description: We grow two different types of cucumbers, eight types of tomatoes, hot peppers, bell peppers, butter lettuce, and kale.
properties.vendor_description: We are a 36,000 square foot greenhouse located east of Didsbury, Alberta. We also grow 12 acres of field vegetables. What sets us apart from other greenhouse and garden growers is that we grow all our vegetables WITHOUT the use of synthetic pesticides. Our kids can walk into the greenhouse and eat fresh veggies right off the vine.
properties.location_name: Coach Hill Patterson Heights Community Association

properties.product_description: Fresh produce, bread, eggs, dairy.
properties.vendor_description:
Fresh Routes is a not-for-profit social enterprise that is focused on creating new, innovative ways of providing healthy and affordable food to as many Canadians as possible ? especially those who need it most.
This market brings healthy, fresh, and affordable food into neighbourhoods facing barriers ? allowing choice, maintaining dignity, and building community.
The Fresh Routes mission is to ensure that everyone has access to affordable, nutritious food and is informed to make healthy decisions and live a healthy life!

properties.product_description: Vine-ripened tomatoes, long English cucumbers, mini cucumbers, broccoli, peppers, eggplant, beans, butterleaf lettuce, herbs, strawberries, fresh eggs, preserves, Noble Meadows goat cheese, and more.
properties.vendor_description: Broxburn Vegetables, located just outside of Lethbridge Alberta has been growing superior quality field and greenhouse fruits and vegetables for over 15 years. Broxburn supplies many of Calgary's top restaurant Chefs with the best quality local fruits and vegetables.

properties.product_description: Delicious apple and pear varieties, sample BC grown nuts, assorted BC mushrooms, apple chips, and farm pressed juices.
properties.vendor_description: We pay fair trade prices to farmers. We source in BC and Alberta. We know who grew your fruit and how. We support small family farms. We provide information on growing practices. Enjoy the tree-ripened difference of orchard direct fruit.

properties.product_description: Wide variety of hyper-local and regional produce, specialty herbs and greens, preserves, fresh eggs
properties.vendor_description: YYC Growers first came together through a love of growing healthy, nutritious food in and around the city, but our belief in food security, accessibility, and concern for land management practices, is what continues to drive us. We are composed of fifteen urban and rural farmers in the City of Calgary and the surrounding area. When you choose to purchase your food from YYC Growers and our member farms, you are inviting us into your home, where your family shares its meals. Magic happens in a food system when the consumer knows the farmer who grew their food. Visit one of our weekly farmstands and get to know your local food system.

Highfield Farm is located on 15-acres in the heart of an industrial community in the city of Calgary. In partnership with the Compost Council of Canada, and The City of Calgary, this farm grows organic produce for charitable donation and for the public.

A partnership between The City of Calgary and Hands on Growing, this new urban farm has a mission to teach people how to grow food so they can teach others how to grow food. This farm grows organic produce for charitable donation and the public. More details to come on this new initiative!

Situated on a 30-acre plot of land in southeast Calgary, the Land of Dreams is an urban farming initiative which brings community, social connection, and food together in one exciting initiative. The project is in partnership with recently arrived immigrants and refugees. Weekly farm stand at the farm starting in August.
